items.title: DMG MORI Chicago Innovation Days 2025: Multi-Technology Machine Highlights
items.author: Practical Machinist
items.summary:
- DMG MORI's new machines integrate *multiple technologies* into one compact platform, drastically reducing production time from two weeks to two hours through additive and subtractive processes combined.
- The machines feature user-friendly controls such as Seimens' Cumeric 1 and built-in motor turrets for versatility and ease of use, supporting advanced functions like 5-axis simultaneous machining.
- Innovations like in-machine 3D scanning close the quality feedback loop, enabling immediate repairs and finishing without removing parts, promoting reshoring and increasing manufacturing efficiency.

items.title: My Go-To G-Code Program for Any New CNC Machine
items.author: Practical Machinist
items.summary: - The video introduces a *safe, simple first G-code program* for CNC beginners, designed to clean the machine table without cutting or spindle engagement. - It emphasizes *safety precautions* like tape dry runs, slow feed overrides, single block execution, and having a finger on the feed hold button. - The program outlines key G-code commands for tool setup, clearance moves, coolant activation, controlled feed moves, and safe machine homing.

items.title: What to Do When Your Machine Shop Gets Too Quiet?
items.author: Practical Machinist
items.summary:
- The podcast covers **solutions for machining slowdowns**, including *diversifying business* and managing costly measurement tools.
- They discuss the challenge of *tool expenses*, suggesting *equipment rental or sharing* among shops as a practical alternative.
- Personal stories highlight *tool borrowing etiquette* and how collaboration can ease tool access and reduce costs.

items.title: How to Program & CNC Machine ANY Design from a Simple Photo
items.author: Practical Machinist
items.summary:
- Learn how to convert any photograph or company logo from a raster image (PNG/JPEG) to a vector image using *Adobe Illustrator's Image Trace* feature.
- Export the vector as a DXF file, import it into CAD/CAM software, *scale and position* it on your part correctly, then generate G-code for CNC machining.
- The process allows *custom engraving* on parts, demonstrated by creating and machining a personalized nameplate with detailed step-by-step guidance.

items.title: How to Use G92 Threading Cycle on a CNC Lathe
items.author: Practical Machinist
items.summary: This video explains the G92 canned threading cycle used in CNC lathe programming, detailing key parameters like approach point, endpoint, feed rate, and depth of cut. It provides practical insights on optimizing thread cutting efficiently and is essential for machinists aiming to save time and improve precision in thread programming.

items.title: Choosing and Maintaining Coolant for One-Person Machine Shops
items.author: Practical Machinist
items.summary: A machinist shares insights on selecting and maintaining coolant in a small shop, emphasizing the importance of proper coolant choice, cleaning, and water quality. The video offers practical tips for extending coolant life and avoiding common issues like foaming and tap breakage, relevant for anyone managing machining fluids.

items.title: Tour of a Tiny CNC Machine Shop Making High-End Film Equipment
items.author: Practical Machinist
items.summary: Jared, owner of Possum Solutions, showcases his compact CNC machine shop where he produces precise custom film industry parts, balancing hobby and second job. The tour reveals innovative use of limited space, advanced probing technology, and automation to enhance capacity, offering inspiration for home machinists and professionals alike.

items.title: Insights into the Life of a Lathe Specialist with Luke Neils
items.author: Practical Machinist
items.summary: Luke Neils, a seasoned machinist and educator, shares his extensive experience with manual and CNC lathe operations, emphasizing the intricacies of cam-driven screw machines and the evolution of machining practices. This discussion offers valuable perspectives for machining professionals and enthusiasts interested in the trade's history and modern challenges.

items.title: Starting and Growing Zealous Manufacturing: An Engineerâ€™s Journey into Machining
items.author: Practical Machinist
items.summary: Zealous Manufacturing, founded by engineer Justin Webb, showcases the journey from a hobbyist to a full-time machine shop owner. The story highlights how passion, perseverance, and hands-on learning can overcome industry challenges, offering insight into small-scale manufacturing's resilience and innovation. This is vital for those interested in entrepreneurship and modern manufacturing.

items.title: How Wire EDM Uses Pulsed Electricity to Cut Metal Precisely
items.author: Practical Machinist
items.summary: This video explains the science behind Wire EDM, detailing how pulsating electrical arcs cut conductive metals accurately by controlling voltage, wire tension, and flushing water pressure. Key machine settings and their impact on cut quality and wire breakage are explored, highlighting the precision and importance of fine adjustments. Essential for machinists seeking to optimize EDM performance and understand its mechanisms.

items.title: Reviving a Family Machine Shop Through Modern Quoting Systems
items.author: Practical Machinist
items.summary: After inheriting her father's machine shop, Ashley overcame challenges in quoting and managing jobs by adopting digital quoting software, which increased sales by 22% in four months. This story highlights how modern tools and knowledge transfer can save traditional manufacturing businesses and ensure legacy continuity.

items.title: Redesigning a Machine Shop for Improved Workflow and Aesthetics
items.author: Practical Machinist
items.summary: Rebecca and Curtis Wolfinger transform their machine shop by improving workflow, lighting, and organization with new paint, vintage furniture, and modern equipment. Their redesign enhances functionality and morale, showcasing how thoughtful workspace improvements can fuel growth and professionalism in small manufacturing environments.

items.title: Insights from EASTEC, Shop Life Updates, and Introducing a New Podcast Segment
items.author: Practical Machinist
items.summary: The Impractical Machinists share their recent experiences at EASTEC, discuss current shop projects, and announce a new segment for their podcast. They reveal industry insights, highlight the value of community connections, and reflect on balancing work with personal life, offering relevance to machinists and enthusiasts alike.

items.title: How Standardized Tooling Transforms Workshop Efficiency
items.author: Practical Machinist
items.summary: Standardizing tooling in machine shops significantly boosts efficiency by reducing setup time and errors, especially as companies scale to more advanced machinery. This approach streamlines tool management, enabling accurate verification and improved ROI, making it essential for workshops aiming for growth and operational excellence.
